critique: This document is an authorization from President Lincoln to suspend habeas corpus in a specific area during the Civil War. It is difficult to assess its position on the traditional left-right political spectrum. The document does not directly address immigration. It expands executive power by authorizing the suspension of habeas corpus. It is difficult to assess its position on federalism. It prioritizes national security over civil liberties by authorizing the suspension of habeas corpus. The document does not directly address economic regulation. The document does not directly address social inclusion.
